—description from the publisher (Polish)

Name: Pixel Tactics: Holiday Heroes Promo Set
Description:
Pixel Tactics: Holiday Heroes is a special Pixel Tactics minipack that features Holiday Heroes! Featuring new characters with new abilities.

Includes:

Leader Name        -    Hero Name
				
				
					==================================Ded Moroz        -    Dread Sorcerer
Easter Bunny        -    Bunny
Guy Fawkes        -    Revolutionary
Krampus            -    Grump
La Calavera Catarina    -    Skeleton
Lord of Misrule        -    Fool
Santa Claus        -    Saint
Uncle Sam        -    Personification

Name: Pixel Tactics: Historical Heroes Promo Set
Description:
Pixel Tactics: Historical Heroes is a special Pixel Tactics minipack that features Historical Heroes! Featuring new characters with new abilities.

Leader Name    -    Hero Name
				
				
					=====================Archimedes    -    Mathematician
Clara Barton    -    Nurse [PTHST]
Julius Caesar    -    Dictator
Lucy        -    Precursor
Marie Curie    -    Radiologist
Nikola Tesla    -    Electrician
Sitting Bull    -    Chieftain
Tokugawa Ieyasu    -    Shogun

Name: Pixel Tactics: Mythology Heroes Promo Set
Description:
Pixel Tactics: Mythology Heroes is a special Pixel Tactics minipack that features Mythology Heroes! Featuring new characters with new abilities.

Leader Name    -    Hero Name
				
				
					=====================Amaterasu    -    Sun Goddess
Cthulhu        -    Old One
Kali        -    Ender
King Arthur    -    King
Quetzacoatl    -    Great Serpent
Sherlock Holmes    -    Detective
Son Wukong    -    Monkey King
Zeus        -    Thunder God

Name: Game Studio Stacker
Description:
You play a game studio and need to build your team and develop the best game. You play Team Member, Studio Event and Publish Event cards to fulfill Game Concept cards. Each Game Concept Card needs a certain number of Skill Points in different areas (Design, Build, Test, Publish) to fulfilled and is worth 1-3 Stars. The first player to gain 8 Stars wins the game.

This game was a free give away by Microsoft at the Game Developers Conference (GDC) 2019.

Name: Monaco
Description:
Monaco has two identical decks of 54 cards. 52 of them have:

     Traditional playing card ranks and suits in the upper left corner (e.g. King of Spades)
     A one- or two-letter prefix in the upper left corner (copied in small print above the card's rank). 
     Four suffixes of 1-4 letters listed below the card's suit along the left side. Each suffix is printed in either black, red, green or brown ink; the mix and order of the colors varies from card to card, so the color is probably significant but the pattern is hard to discern. 


The remaining 2 cards contain a list of 300 words, each of which is a combination of a prefix and a suffix from the other cards. These words actually look mostly like nonsense words and are likely a set of names, perhaps associated with Monaco.

It looks apparent that an important part of the game is to combine cards so that a prefix and a suffix combine to make a word in the list.  But the game's mechanics, the meaning of the different colors, and even its publication details are unknown until a copy of their rules can be found.

—user summary

Name: Texas Poker
Description:
The game's contents consist of 104 cards -- each of which shows the rank and suit of five traditional cards -- and 4 jokers. The five cards thus comprise a poker hand, and every type of poker hand is included: royal flush, straight flush, four of a kind, full house, flush, straight, three of a kind, two pairs, one pair, high single card.

—user summary

RULES FOR TEXAS POKER

To play this game, remember each card has a five-card Poker hand, for a total of 104 different Poker hands in two decks of cards. It is like playing with 520 regular playing cards.

For fast Texas Poker, play with one card to each player where the best five-card poker hand wins. You may exchange that one card for another if you wish to. High hand wins.

Now, try playing with two Texas Poker Cards to each player, making the best five-card Poker hand from the now ten different numbers and suits each player has. You may also exchange or draw one more card, turning in to the dealer your discard. Try playing 6-7-8-9 or even 10 Poker with just two cards.

You may play this together with an ordinary deck of cards. To play the game this way, deal out one card from the Texas Poker Deck to each player. Each player may then receive up to three cards from the regular deck of cards. Have Fun!!! Plus, make your own rules.

NO SHOOTING, PLEASE ...

—description from the back of the box

Name: Coreball: The Zero Gravity Sport – Technoticks Team Expansion
Description:
The Technoticks are the most tech savvy team in the professional league. Their suits are fitted with the most advanced partial AI computers and they can hack anything in a matter of miliseconds. Their trickery makes them the most hated foe by the other teams. They enjoy that.

The Technoticks Team Expansions contains:
3 x Technotick miniatures.
6 x Merc miniatures in Technotick colours.
9 x Flyer cards.
16 x Playing cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Footenstein
Description:
Object of the game is to remove all the bolts from Frankenstein's foot one by one using the included "mad scientist wrench" tool. One wrong move and the foot comes "alive". There are several difficulty levels the game can be set to. The players are eliminated if they cause the foot to move - the last player standing is the winner.

—user summary

Name: LINGO
Description:
The LINGO deck consists of 54 playing cards. Each contains a letter and a number 1-11.

Each player is dealt 3 cards, and in a turn a player either plays 1-3 cards to the table to form a word, or draws 1 card and discards 1 card.

The cards in the center form a 5x5 array. With the first word played, one of the cards is designated as the center of the square. After the first word, each word must use all the cards played and at least one card already on the table. Consecutive letters in a word must be adjacent in any direction, orthogonal or diagonal, but the word as a whole may zigzag and change directions. It's like the array from Big Boggle, built up gradually with cards rather than dice.

Each word scores like this: letters already on the board score their printed value, letters played from the hand are double their value, unless they are played to a corner of the square, or are the last cards played in the square, in which case their value is tripled.

Their is also a solitaire game: one plays cards in a row, one at a time, and when a set of consecutive cards make a word, they are made into a single pile with any of those letters on the top. If all the cards can be combined into a single pile at the end, one wins.

—user summmary

Name: Race to Planet X: Number Bond Game
Description:
Race to Planet X: Number Bond Game is a board game that has fun game mechanics and helps K-3rd graders master number bonds, addition, and subtraction. Families can play a quick game in 15 minutes, and score some major parenting points for non-screen family time that also doubles as math practice for the kids.

The Game: 

     Take turns making Power Combos (3 cards that make a number bond) to move forward on the game board. 
     Make Power Combos before another player ZAPs a card from your hand. SCORE your Power Combos before another player SMASH one and make you move backwards. 
     First to reach Planet X wins!


—description from the publisher

Name: Nuts And Bots
Description:
In Nuts And Bots, 2-4 players compete to construct their giant robot, a MegaBot, by building it part by part. First player to build their MegaBot wins.

The board is the Factory and consists of shared Workstation Tiles that players move around the Factory to form Assembly Lines. Blueprints show the pattern of Workstations required in an Assembly Line to build legs, torsos, arms, and heads, and all of these are needed to complete a MegaBot.

Players have a number of WorkBots and can build more. WorkBots are the driving force in the Factory and each Workstation needs a WorkBot on it. Only then will the Workstation be a functioning part of an Assembly Line. Only by moving Workstations around the Factory to match a Blueprint and placing a WorkBot on each Workstation will the next part of a MegaBot come rolling off the Assembly Line.

On their turn, players can move a Workstation and move a WorkBot. Each type of Workstation is limited in number, and players will try to move Workstations out of other players’ Assembly Lines to use within their own. Take control of a Workstation by having more WorkBots on it than anyone else, then it can be moved. Protect a Workstation by having enough WorkBots left on it to prevent the other players moving it.

Nuts And Bots has simple rules and simple actions but requires thought and puzzle-solving to win in an ever-changing environment.

—description from the publisher

Name: X Arrr!
Description:
In X Arrr!, 2-4 pirate crews journey around an island full of secret paths to collect their buried treasure. X marks the spot! The first player to get both pirates and all of their treasure back to their ship is the winner. Arrr!

The island is built randomly from discs showing paths that can be rotated to link with the paths on neighbouring island discs. On their turn players can change paths or rotate any island disc. Pirates automatically move forward if rotating an island disc extends the path the pirate is on, and if they pass over a treasure they’ll pick it up, but end their turn on the same disc as another pirate crew and they’ll be ambushed.

It takes skill to navigate the island, collect all the treasures, and avoid the other pirate crews, but make the right moves and a pirate can travel long distances along the same style of path in their turn.

X Arrr! usually plays in 20-25 minutes. It has simple rules and simple actions but still requires players to think and plan to win the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Wobuga
Description:
Wobuga comes from WOrd BUilding GAme.

It includes 72 letters: 6 each for A, E, I, O; 4 each for U, Y; 2 each of all other letters.

To start, the letters are stirred face down, and each player draws 5 letters. A turn consists of drawing a letter and then either making a word out of one's hand, or adding one or more letters to words already on the table without rearranging their order.  After playing, a player draws again and continues playing until announcing "I am thru", and the turn goes to the left. One can also make a sentence out of their own words, after which those words cannot be further altered. When a turn is over and other players see plays they could have done, they say "Wobuga" and can make the play for them and score the points they could have scored.

Points scored are: 5 points for each letter played during one's turn, 10 points for each word of a sentence, and 25 points for making the word "Wobuga".  The highest score when all the letters are used wins.

There is also a solitaire mode where a player takes repeated turns and tries to use all the letters.  Also, Wobuga Rush, where two players each play with a half deck in solitaire mode, and play through all their letters.  Each player gets 5 points for each letter not used, and -10 points for being the first to say "I am thru"; the lower score wins.

—user summary

Name: Word for Word
Description:
Includes a deck of 61 cards having two sets of consonants (42) and three sets of vowels (15) (each letter having a point value), and four wild cards; plus a reference card showing the letter values, and a 1-minute sand timer.

Players have hands of 8 cards. The first player lays down a word from their hand of at least 3 cards. From then on, a turn is made by making a new word using at least one of the cards on the table, and at least on of the cards in the hand (the unused table cards are discarded), and drawing back up to an 8 card hand. The new word's score is the sum of the letter values newly laid down, with the older letters not scoring; except if all the table letters are used then the score is the entire word, doubled; if all the cards in hand are used in the new word the score is the entire word tripled.

The game ends when every player has had an equal number of turns after a player's score reaches a pre-determined total.

The solitaire game has the player playing cards to the table one at a time, either starting a new column (up to 5 columns), or adding a letter to an existing column. Two columns can also be combined end to end. Whenever a column forms a complete word it can be removed. The player wins if they can remove all the cards.

—user summary

Name: Skruuvi
Description:
Skruuvi is a Finnish relative of Auction Whist (which is essentially Bridge without a dummy).

Like Bridge, it's a four player, partnership trick taking game. Players bid how many of the thirteen tricks their partnership can win (or, unlike Bridge, lose). Also, players can communication information about their hands through their bids (and, unlike Bridge, the cards they can exchange) with a system of conventions. Here are the main differences:


     Players get to exchange cards with each other. There are two ways of playing Skruuvi depending on how players exchange cards: Kitty games and No-kitty games.


- In a Kitty game, players receive 12 cards; the four undealt cards is the kitty. The highest bidder adds the kitty to their hand, then gives any four cards to their partner. The partner adds these cards to their hand, then gives one card to each of the other three players.

- In a No-kitty game, players receive 13 cards. The highest bidder gives any four cards to their partner. The partner adds these cards to their hand, then returns any four cards back to the highest bidder.


     Players optionally play several rounds of Bolshevik, where one player attempts to win or lose all 13 tricks (without a partner).



     Players can bid misere, which is a bid of how many tricks a partnership will lose (without a trump suit).



     As mentioned, there is no dummy!



     As in Bridge, the lowest bid is to win 7 out of the 13 tricks. However, the lowest bid you can win the auction round is 11 tricks! (Or for misere bids, to lose 11 tricks!) In No-kitty games, the lowest bid is to win 12 out of the 13 tricks. 



     A game of Skruuvi lasts 24 rounds. Each player plays with a different partner for 8 rounds each.


—user summary

Name: LinkUs
Description:
Linkus! is a fast and fun party game based on associations and their interpretations.

In Linkus! players try to connect one picture on the card from his hand with one of the pictures on the card in the center of the table by association link. Each card has 3 different pictures on it. Players must play as fast as they can because time is limited. They play cards in clockwise order turn by turn. Player can not use the same picture that was used by the previous player.

In the game there are two different modes: Competitive and Cooperative. Also you will have 360 unique illustrations to enrich your game experience.

—description from the designer

Name: Mindblock
Description:
Mindblock plays similar to Rummikub in that players have a hand of items and want to play them into a common space in sets and runs, with those sets and runs being breakable should you be able to rearrange things in order to play more from your hand.

What's different about Mindblock is that players can stack smaller blocks together in order to use them as a larger number, giving you more play opportunities to get pieces out of your hand.

Name: Cyber Siege
Description:
About: In Cyber Siege everyone is a hacker trying to gain control of the system through use of programs, once you have uploaded or install all your bytes of data to the system you have taken control. Cyber Siege is a game that uses temporary alliances, strategy, and program actions to advance your own agenda, or slow down your opponents. Discussion, deals, persuasion, and even temporary treaties are allowed and encouraged. Turns are fast in this game and everyone stays engages the whole game. The rules are simple to understand but there is still strategic depth. Players will attempt to take control of Programs by installing more bytes of data then their opponents.

Victory Condition: Be the first player to Upload or Install all your bytes of data from your hard drive into the System!

Game Play: 
Cyber Siege consists of several game rounds separated into three phases:

     Install Phase: Players take turns installing bytes of data into one of many programs in order to take majority control and take the programs action.
     Execution Phase: Players take turns executing programs. Each program has a special ability that either helps yourself or hurts one of your opponents. But because the scoring is hidden no one knows for sure who is winning, therefor deflection and collusion to change who to attack is an open table discussion.
     Packet Generation Phase: Players simultaneously generate there data packet (the number of bytes of data they will get to install on the following round) based upon the actions executed by the program.


—description from the publisher

Name: Morgarhum Market
Description:
Morgarhum Market is a 2-player mini game played with a deck of 18 cards. In the game, players are rival traders in the fictional market town of Morgarhum.

Players will draw and play cards representing goods of different values such as weapons, food, drink and accessories. Each goods card also has an action that is activated when played, allowing players to do such things as conceal goods, alter the value of goods on the market, or to have certain goods confiscated.

Additional powerful abilities are available by bribing town officials and players must decide when or if to activate these.

Players compete over three rounds to have the highest value goods on their market stall, with each round representing a day of trading.

—description form the publisher

Name: Gangster Dice: New Blood
Description: First expansion for Gangster Dice, New Blood, which adds 6 dice and 4 bid cards for a 5th player, 12 favor cards, and 8 new characters not in the basic game.

Name: Semper Fidelis Alliance
Description:
Game of battles with miniatures. Quick and easy rules to play immediately. The game comes with a book with the basic rules and lists of fighters. It is proposed as a cooperative game, in which different players (or only one) face an automated and undaunted enemy that does not know surrender.

—description from the designer

Name: Stribe
Description:
A simple card game for kids. Cards show images of figures in different occupations (fireman, clown, diver etc) - and there are between 1 and 4 of each occupation in the deck.

Place out any card from your hand next to any others already out - in vertical or horizontal lines. If your card is the same as the card at the other end of the row or column, take the whole line.

Try to win the most cards.

—user summary

Name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Corsair Coat
Description:
Promo gear card that were included with the Pinpup Swashbuckler, which is not part of the game.

The Generic Hard Plastic Swashbuckler is packaged in a custom printed box and includes:

Hard plastic Generic Swashbuckler miniature
Hard Plastic Kingdom Death 30mm round scenic insert and base
Large Matte Art Print
Corsair Coat gear card with rules to include in your campaign

The Swashbuckler is the result of a collaboration between Adam & Lokman, exploring some well established tropes in fantasy art. Originally intended as a small line of Generic Hero Classes, the results were so compelling and un-generic, each hero's appearance told so many exciting stories that we wanted to integrate them into the KD world but so far nothing concrete has emerged.

Plundering indiscriminately, the swashbucklers crippling kleptomania keeps her ship barely bobbing over the surface of the waves. Lost at sea as a child, she spent years surviving along on a deserted island. Scavenging for scraps to eke out a meager existence she pathologically finds need to ransack her victims for strange odds and ends.

Her fate took a turn when she boarded a cursed gallion, stealing a coat of otherworldly splendor. The coat, armed with spectral pistols fires at random, often causing violent accidents and winning her no friends.

Name: Exo
Description:
A simple tile placement game; 27 planet tiles are piled in a random heap on the table and players take turns selecting one that has no other tile on top of it and placing it in their "galaxy."

Planet tiles each have three characteristics: size, color, and type. Once the tiles are taken as evenly as possible players score for lines of three planets which share a characteristic.

—user summary

Name: UNO Attack: Jurassic World
Description:
You've never played UNO like this before! Now with a Jurassic World theme, the rules are similar to those of regular UNO Attack, but this game features the "Attack! Attack!" command card that offers an exciting and unpredictable way to play UNO. If you draw that card you’ll have to push the button on the Dilophosaurus shooter, and you’ll either be the target of a stream of UNO Attack Jurassic World cards, or you will get lucky and nothing will happen! But if you’re not so lucky, the shooter will fire a stream of cards that you have to add to your hand! And when the shooter is launching cards, it makes a variety of funny sounds that add energy and silliness to the game. UNO Attack Jurassic World adds speed and surprise to the game because you never know when an attack is coming! The goal is still to get rid of all the cards in your hand, and when you’re down to one card, don’t forget to yell, “UNO!” Contains 112 cards, Dilophosaurus shooter, and instructions. The unit is both portable and designed to help with storage—you can keep the cards right inside the shooter!

Now Jurassic World fans can play a special version of UNO Attack!:
The "Attack! Attack!" card - When this card is played, whoever played it gets to call any color and then choose ANY OTHER PLAYER in the game to “Attack.”  The Dilophosaurus Card Launcher is rotated to face the chosen player, and then “attacking” player gets to press down on the Dilophosaur’s nose twice.  The player being “attacked” must keep all the cards that come out of the launcher.  The game then continues with the next player in regular rotation (the second player to the left – or right in Reverse rotation - of the player who played the Wild Attack-Attack card).

The goal is to get rid of all the cards in your hand, and the first player or team to 500 wins. When you’re down to one card, don’t forget to yell “UNO”!

—description from the publisher
Families: Versions & Editions: Versions with IP after the original release

Name: Operation F.A.U.S.T.: Special Antiquities Promo Pack
Description:
Pack Contains:

5 Paintings: 2 Degenerate, 2 Forgery and 1 Regular
1 Statue
1 Altar Piece

Name: Roads & Boats: 20th Anniversary Edition
Description:
For the 20th anniversary of Roads & Boats, the game is being reprinted for the fifth time. This edition will include the &Cetera expansion, so the game can be played with up to six players and you will get all the additional modules of &Cetera included in the game. There are no other changes to the game.

In Roads & Boats, each player builds a civilization over a long period of time, as in many other games. Unlike most games, however, the emphasis is not on warfare, population growth, city or statebuilding, but on logistics, or rather on transport. Each player starts the game with three donkeys, a pile of wooden boards, a number of stones, and two geese. With these few resources, you try to build such diverse things as woodcutters, roads, boats, mines, a stock exchange... but beware! There is no concept of territory in this game! You cannot own land, nor buildings, so the things you build can be used by any other player...

The original game can be played by two to four players, but it can also be used as a one-person puzzle.

&Cetera adds new buildings, new goods, new land types, new transporters, new ways to win, and new strategies. It also includes 24 new scenarios and material to play with five or six players. & Cetera contains all the rules and material previously published as Planes & Trains, plus a lot more.

—description from the publisher

Name: Red Alert: Space Fleet Warfare – Logistics & Space Platform Escalation Pack
Description:
Escalation packs present additional starship models, rules, and terrain to add to the RED ALERT core game.

This escalation Pack contains:

     1 space platform
     8 transport ships
     1 rulebook 
     2 punchboards of counters
Families: Game: Red Alert – Space Fleet Warfare

Name: Red Alert: Space Fleet Warfare – Vice Admiral Flagship Escalation Pack
Description:
Escalation packs present additional starship models, rules, and terrain to add to the RED ALERT core game.

This escalation Pack contains:

     1 Commonwealth Vice Admiral flagship
     3 Commonwealth cap fighters
     1 Confederation Vice Admiral flagship
     3 Confederation cap fighters
     1 rulebook 
     1 punchboard of counters
Families: Game: Red Alert – Space Fleet Warfare

Name: Red Alert: Space Fleet Warfare – Meteor Storm Escalation Pack
Description:
Escalation packs present additional starship models, rules, and terrain to add to the RED ALERT core game.

This escalation Pack contains:

     1 rulebook containing special rules and 2 new scenarios
     2 punchboards of meteors
     2 six-sided dice
Families: Game: Red Alert – Space Fleet Warfare

Name: Red Alert: Space Fleet Warfare – Space Rift Escalation Pack
Description:
Escalation packs present additional starship models, rules, and terrain to add to the RED ALERT core game.

This escalation Pack contains:

     1 rulebook containing special rules and 3 new scenarios
     2 punchboards featuring space rift hexes
     3 six-sided dice
Families: Game: Red Alert – Space Fleet Warfare

Name: Scorpion Dice Game
Description: A dice game in a tube, where the dice have a scorpion instead of the 1. The object is to get the highest score after 3 turns.

Name: mau mau!! Das Brettspiel
Description:
Unlike the classic card game, Mau Mau - the board game is not just about getting rid of your cards quickly and saying Mau Mau - it's about get as many points as possible. Shouting Mau Mau doesn't end the game, but gives you 5 bonus points. Playing identical cards and some special spaces also wins bonus points. The game ends when all the spaces on the board are covered with cards. The winner of this fast-paced board game version of the classic card game is the player who scored the most points!

—description from the back of the box

Draw two on the 7, skip a turn on the 8 - the famous card game mau mau gets its own special charm as a board game. Anyway, if Reiner Knizia takes over the implementation.

Placing a suitable card on another, the next player must react - this is the classic principle of mau mau. The suit or number must match the previously placed card. Reiner Knizia has transferred this principle to the game board: tiles are placed on a path. The color or symbol shown must match the adjacent tile. Special fields provide surprise effects. And the classics such as "two draw" or "skip" are also present here. For the penultimate card, announce "mau"; for the last card, "mau mau" also applies. However: "mau mau" is not the end. But only when all fields on the map are occupied. This creates tension: the winner is not who got rid of his cards first, but who has collected the most points.

So it is important to proceed strategically and reach the special fields, because they certainly lead to the coveted point chips. In addition, you usually have several investment options.

—description form the publisher (translated)

Name: Rally Point Volume 16: A World at World War 1937-1945
Description:
Rally Point Volume 16: A World at War 1937-1945 is a set of 10 all new scenarios that are set in World War II. These scenarios were originally scheduled to appear in Schwerpunkt Volume #24. Production of future volumes of Schwerpunkt is on hiatus for the foreseeable future, so the Tampa ASL Group decided to publish them in the pages of Rally Point instead. Each scenario was handmade and play-tested to the high standard players expect from the Tampa ASL Group’s fine craftsmen. Each scenario is presented in the Schwerpunkt easy-to-read format on high-quality card stock.

RPT151 Luodian Lament – LUODIAN, China, 23 August 1937: Nineteen squads from the Chinese 66th Regiment attack to clear the defending 44th Japanese Regiment (11 squads) from the village on boards 10z and 70. This medium-sized 5.5 turn scenario is a tense all infantry action that features Chinese OBA.

RPT152 Shaken Not Stirred – VILLERS-MAREUIL, France 29 May 1940: Six R35 tanks and seventeen squads conduct a rare French combined arms attack to seize five buildings from twelve defending squads of the German 57th Infantry. This 4.5 turn scenario is set four half boards: 64, 65, 67 and 70.

RPT153 Run Gurkha Run – ASUN, Malaya, 11 December 1941: The title says it best. A company of Gurkha infantry is forced to withdraw across boards 17 and 72 while being hotly pursued by thirteen squads of the Japanese 11th Infantry Regiment and three supporting Ha-Go tanks. This 5 turn scenario has lots of exciting action that usually culminates in a Banzai charge near the end.

RPT154 Mars Begins – GREDIANKO, U.S.S.R., 25 November 1942: If you like fighting in the snow, this Eastern Front gem is for you. Twenty Russian squads supported by Lee, KVI and T-34 tanks attack to clear eleven German squads from the buildings on board 3a. This action-packed, 5 turn scenario (Designed by Mike Augustine) features German OBA and Russian rocket artillery.

RPT155 Schutzstaffel Shindig- GRUSCHKI GRAVE, West of Kharkov, Ukraine, U.S.S.R. 31 August 1943: In this 5.5 turn, medium-sized scenario, a company of ten Russian tanks (T-34s and a KV-2) from the 2nd Tank Corps attacks with infantry riders to clear two StuGs and two PzIVF2s supported by panzer-grenadiers of the 5th SS Panzer Division “Wiking” from the hills overlooking the roads on boards 18 and 61. This tank battle will test your nerves and require you to use all your tank fighting skills.

RPT156 Wiking Rescue- ZERCZYCE, and STACJA-NURZEC, Poland, 22 July 1944: Veteran Tampa ASL Group member, “Mountain Man” Dave Brown makes his designing debut with this unique scenario in which both sides get to attack. A full SS panzer-grenadier company mounted in halftracks and supported by Panther tanks from the 5th SS Panzer Division “Wiking” attacks to clear a farmstead and relieve the besieged Penal Battalion 560. Will the fifteen Russian squads and six SU-76ms from the 44th Rifle Division overrun their village before help arrives? This is an action-packed, 5.5 turn, scenario that uses boards 9a, 16 and 43.

RPT157 Ozarks and Frundsbergers – RURDORF, Germany, 2 December 1944: A company of American infantry from the 102nd “Ozark” Infantry Division with five supporting Sherman tanks tries to out-flank and cut off the retreat of seven squads, an SPW251/22 and a PSW 234/3 from the 10th SS Panzer Division “Frundsberg”. This fast playing, 5 turn scenario is set on boards 53 and 72.

RPT158 Hungarian Hetzers – EBED, Upper Hungary, 6 January 1945: Eight Russian squads, four T-34s and an SU-85 from the 22nd Guards Tank Brigade attack to clear the village on boards 1a and 9a. Here, the Hungarian Division “Szent Laszlo” is defending with six squads and three Hetzers, one of which must exit the board. This 4.5 turn scenario is perfect for tournament play and has lots of tense action that is sure to go down to the last CC Phase.

RPT159 Lesson Learned in Lessin – LESSIN, West Prussia, 25 January 1945: The Soviet 9th Tank Corps attacks with a company of infantry, two IS-2s and four T-34/85s to clear elements of the 7th Panzer Division from buildings along a frozen lake. Hidden JgPz IV/70s on the opposite shore pour deadly flanking fire upon the attacking Russians, making this an exciting Eastern Front action in the snow. Mike Augustine designed this 5.5 turn scenario that uses boards 75 and 79.

RPT160 Willie und Fritz – MUSKAU, Poland, 10 March 1945: Elements of the Soviet 112th Rifle Division (17 squads) with two ISU 122s and four IS-2s execute a two-pronged attack to seize five buildings. Fallschirm Grenadier Regiment Hermann Göring defends this town with thirteen squads along with three Panthers and must simultaneously prevent the Russians from exiting two AFVs. This 5.5 turn scenario has multiple victory conditions and a unique tactical situation that provides a lot of re-playability. It is set on boards 2, 3b and 79.

Name: Tragedy Looper: Young Girl
Description:
A promotional card available in the 4th Issue of "Game Jamboree"
Depicts "Young Girl", or 'å¥³ã®å­' (Onnanoko)

Paranoia Limit: 1
Tags: girl, student
Starting Location: School
Passive: This character cannot move to the Shrine, City or Hospital
Goodwill Abilities:
1: This character's location restriction is removed
3: (1xL) Move this character to an adjacent location

Name: Dicey Crafting
Description:
Dicey Crafting is a single player, dungeon crawling, dice rolling adventure game.

The gameplay consists of a deck of monsters that you must battle your way through to complete the game. You also have a weapon (how you attack) and a shield (your health) that are crafted out of dice. These gear pieces lose durability (the number decreases on them) as you attack enemies and they attack you. As a gear piece wears out you can 'mine' dice from a dice mine, roll them, and re-craft your weapon.

Game time is between 30 to 45 mins. You can build the monster deck smaller for a shorter game.

—description from the designer

Name: The Phantom: Treasures of Drakon
Description:
The Phantom: Treasures of Drakon is a character driven race through a temple to hoard treasure to save them from the sinking island.

You will encounter hidden traps, sacred rooms and of course your nemesis.

Players use available action points to plan their way through the temple. Your hand of cards can aid your plans to steal items from other players, move faster or down hidden routes, avoid traps.

Each player has a custom dice, player board, unique player power and mini to move around the board.

The competitive game is won by accumulating the most Victory Points, and the game ends at a pre-determined amount of rounds organised at the start. The rounds are arranged in the form of a comic strip. There are also co-operative and solo game modes.

Name: Dominance: Renaissance Rules 1494-1529
Description:
A set of miniature war game rules dealing with battles in Western Europe from 1494 to 1529. Includes rules for moving miniatures, firing weapons, morale and fighting in melee. The goal is to defeat your opponent through superior tactics. There are several army lists provided. The Army Lists are: Early English, Late English, Florentine, Early French, Late French, Holy Roman Empire, 
Spanish Holy Roman Empire, Irish, Italian Independent City State,    Milanese, Neapolitan, Borgia Papal, Papal, Scottish, Early Spanish, Late Spanish, Swiss Confederation and Venetian.

—user summary

Name: Casino
Description:
This is a roll-and-move board game, which merges the gameplay of Monopoly with Casino "mini-games."

On a player's turn, they roll two dice and move clock-wise around a board, and take the action of the spot they land on.

If a player lands on a property, and it is unowned, they may purchase it. If it is owned, then they must play the owner rent money.

If they land on "Tough Luck" and "Jackpot" card spots, the player takes a card from the corresponding card pile and follows the instructions on the chosen card.

The unique aspect of the game is that if you land on a "Casino" spot, then the player plays a Casino "mini-game." There are four mini-games: Roulette, Black Jack, Craps, and slots. (The game comes with a small roulette wheel, and dice to replicate slot machines.) Players can place bets on these games.

The first player to reach $35,000 (or the person with the most money after a set amount of time) is the winner.

—user summary

Name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Till Death Do Us Part
Description:
Two new Principle cards that were included with the Pinpups Intimacy Couple, which is not part of the game.

This cinematic pair is accompanied by new Kingdom Death: Monster promo material: prototype rules. Principle: Bonding is a lasting choice. Decide what partnership means to your settlement and replace your partnership innovation. Will partners strive for a lasting legacy in the future or to leave the biggest mark on the world with their combined fury. These rules are optional content for your game that may have far-reaching consequences for your campaign. Prototype rules are currently evaluated at KD HQ but we enjoy their thematic possibilities and offer this new content as is.

When the lantern light is at its dimmest, there's no one else I'd rather have at my back. The Intimacy Couple faces peril together, unflinching faith in their union to the end, even as it draws near.

Name: Top Tale: The O.G – Volume 1
Description:
The card game, TOP TALE, is a new type of game that takes the process of getting to know your fellow human and makes it a fun, often insightful, experience. The game is meant to appeal to just about anyone from any background, and can be used as an ice breaker or as a tool to get people to open up.

TOP TALE is a deck of cards where each card has a topic on it. Along with each topic, there's a caption that is meant to spark ideas for responses to the topic, or in many cases the caption is just meant to get a chuckle out of the players to help lighten to mood. Topics are things like, "Your Worst Day at School", where each person is expected to recount their worst day at school story. The game has some hidden strategies, where it's not always about what stories are told, but sometimes how entertaining they are when told.

At the end of each round of game play, each player votes for their favorite response without voting on their own, and the person with the most votes wins the round. If there's a tie, then you have a tiebreaker round between those that tied, responding to a new topic card. The game continues until you hit a predetermined number of cards, or you all call it quits.

—description from the designer

Name: Ninjas!!: The Stealth Assassin Showdown
Description:
The deadliest martial arts experts have gathered in a secret arena to engage the ultimate stealth assassin showdown. As each is evenly matched in strength, skill, and speed, only cunning and courage will tell who will be the last one standing.

Ninjas!! The Stealth Assassin Showdown is a battle royale board game for 2 to 4 players, who use deduction to find and strike moving opponents while trying to evade attacks themselves.

The game is played on a 10-by-10 grid, and involves playable Move and Attack cards, as well as Ninja Star and Footprint tokens. Each player begins with the same hand of 12 cards--the 12 Styles of Ninja, which depict and describe the strategies in the ninja's toolbox, and which can be used to help find, hit, or dodge opponents. Turns alternate between Moves and Attacks, in which all players plan secretly, and then reveal and resolve simultaneously. Players record their own turns and track evidence of their opponents' movements in writing on a Notepad.

Although the in-game goals remain the same for every game of Ninjas!!, players can change the end-game conditions to allow for different game times and styles of gameplay. The standard game involved 3 wounds and player elimination, other options include Sudden Death matches as well as point-based games in which players count the number of successful attacks against the number of times they were wounded. Each game of Ninjas!! can also be played on a differently laid out board and with different starting positions.

-description from publisher

Name: Tremor
Description:
Set in a post apocalyptic world destroyed by climate change, Tremor is a 2 to 4 player medium weight strategy game where you redesign and rearrange the board every turn.  As an animal ancestral spirit,  to win you must exploit a disaster-ridden world to help your species progress, while hindering your opponents. The goal is to save your species by helping them reach their last remaining natural habitat in the opposite corner of the board, before your rivals get to theirs.
â€‹
Tremor is played on a modular tile board. On your turn you must take 3 actions in any order: Traverse, Tectonic Twist, and Scout (a choice of component actions Explore and Forecast).

These actions allow players to move across the board towards their goal, reorient tiles, and accumulate Tremor Tokens. Tremor Tokens are placed on the separate Catastrophe Board, and players must strategically allocate and optimise them to ignite a disaster.

There are 6 disasters that will help or hinder your passage to safety. Each of them have unique effects, and the area of the board they affect is based on how you manipulate their position and orientation. You can also evade, combo and amplify their effects by using secret Catastrophe Cards, Disaster Die rolls, and abilities unique to your species.

Tremor can be played as a competitive or team co-operative game. It's easy to learn and hard to master, making it suitable for all skill levels. Games last between 30-60 minutes depending on how seriously you take your strategy.

— Jonah, Curly Bros Games

Name: Onslaught: The Card Game
Description:
Onslaught is a fantasy, military unit card game for 2-6 players. Your hand makes up your army and it's you vs everyone else. Using your dice rolls and card special abilities to knock out opponent cards, while withering their retaliation. Can you survive the Onslaught? The last player with any remaining cards gains a victory. Play goes till one champion emerges with two victories.

Players choose between 2 styles of play every time there's a new hand. Either Offense or Defense. Each gives a player unique mode of play with variable powers. This mixed with the card special abilities grants a wide range of tactical options. Players can play to their cards, the benefits of a play style or to their personal preferences. Each hand comes with many diverse possibilities.

Ready to join the battleground? Many may enter, but only one survives the Onslaught!

—description from the publisher

Name: Throne: I Guardiani di Kalesh
Description:
Theme

A Strategic fantasy medieval cards game for 2-8 players, all against all or cooperative.

"Throne is a game of duels, betrayals and false alliances to contend the Throne for world domination. Ancient Guilds will face each other in epic fights without exclusion of sword blow, they will have to defend themselves from the attacks of threatening Dragons and will be able to find comfort with great drinks of good Wine! Will you have the necessary valor to reach the Legendary Kalesh and face its Guardians? What will your destiny reserve? This will depend only on you!"

Game Play

Starting from the youngest player and in order of age, each player chooses their own Guild.
Once the two decks "Main Deck" and "Armory Deck" have been mixed and positioned, the players choose the configuration of the Armory Board, between the two available (the dashboard is double-face). Assign the "Destiny Deck" ordered from 1 to 20 to the first player (the youngest player, or the last winner). Each player selects the Lord (Loyal) or Guardian (Traitor) of the chosen Guild and a random character from the remaining cards of the same Guild. Each players turn consist of 3 main phases, "Draw", "Play", "End of Turn".The round goes clockwise.

     In the "Draw" phase, the player must draws 2 cards from the Main Deck.
     In the "Play" phase the player has no card limits that he can play except for the Constraints (only 1 "Hit Type" card each turn, use the "Valor" ability once, can have a maximum of 4 "Equipments") in play, he can only have one weapon in play, he can use his ability and effects only once each turn),


he can draw buy and sell Armory cards.

     In the third phase "End of Turn", if the player has more than 5 cards in his hand, he discards the excess, if he has less than 5 he can decide to discard all and draw 5 new cards.


The player suffers the effects of the Poison Markers if he owns and finally fight the dragons if they are active in the game.

Goals of the Game
 The players will play with the aim of conquering the enemy Guild tokens, which are won by eliminating the characters owned by each opponents with their own cards.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Throne - I Guardiani di Kalesh è il secondo gioco di Wegas-Studios di Fabio Napolitano. 
Gioco completamente Made in Italy, rilasciato nell'Aprile del 2019.

Tema

Gioco di carte strategico fantasy medievale da 2-8 giocatori, in modalità tutti contro tutti o cooperativa. 
Throne è un gioco di duelli, tradimenti e false alleanze per contendersi l’unico Trono per il dominio del mondo. Antiche Gilde si affronteranno in epici scontri senza esclusione di Colpi, dovranno difendersi dagli attacchi di minacciosi Draghi e potranno trovare conforto con grandi bevute di buon Vino! Avrai il coraggio necessario per raggiungere la Leggendaria Kalesh e fronteggiare i suoi Guardiani? Cosa riserverà il tuo Destino? Questo dipenderà solo da te!

Game Play

A partire dal giocatore più giovane ed in ordine di età, ogni giocatore sceglie la propria Gilda di appartenenza. 
Una volta mescolati e posizionati i due mazzi "Mazzo di Gioco" e "Mazzo Armeria" i giocatori scelgono la configurazione della plancia, tra le due disponibili (la plancia è duble-fas) si assegna il "Mazzo Destino" ordinato da 1 a 20 al Capoturno (il giocatore più giovane). Ogni giocatore seleziona il Lord (Leale) o il Guardiano (Traditore) della gilda scelta e un personaggio a caso dei restanti appartenenti alla stessa gilda. I giocatori affronteranno a rotazione un turno composto da 3 fasi principali, "Pescare", "Giocare", "Fine Turno". 

     Nella fase "Pescare" il giocatore pesca 2 carte dal Mazzo di Gioco. 
     Nella fase "Giocare" il giocatore non ha limiti di carte che può giocare ad eccezione dei Vincoli (1 sola carta di "Tipo Colpo" a turno, usare 1 volta sola l'abilità "Coraggio", può avere massimo 4 "Equipaggiamenti" in gioco, può avere solo un arma in gioco, può usare abilità ed effetti una sola volta a turno), può usare l'abilità del suo personaggio, pescare vendere e acquistare carte dell'Armeria.
     Nella terza fase "Fine Turno" se un giocatore ha più di 5 carte in mano scarta quelle in eccesso, se ne ha meno di 5 può decidere di scartarle tutte e pescarne 5 nuove. 


Il giocatore subisce gli effetti dei Segnalini Veleno se li possiede e in fine affronta i draghi se sono attivi in gioco.

Scopo del Gioco
 I giocatori a turno giocheranno con l'obbiettivo di conquistare i segnalini delle Gilde nemiche, che si conquistano eliminando con le proprie carte i personaggi posseduti dagli avversari.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Rymdisar
Description:
Rymdisar comes with a blank playing board showing a picture of space, and 14 cardboard disks to be placed out onto the board, making the playing path.

13 disks show "spacies" and they show actions such as "+2", "change 1", or "miss a turn".

One disk has a rocket, and says "Fly!"

Each player has a marker and starts with 4 gems of different colours.

Players roll a die, and move along the playing path the number of dots shown. They then need to do the action of the space they land upon. In this way, they can gain or exchange gems, until someone has 5 of the same colour.
—user summary

Take a space walk through the stars and meet friendly Spacies! Through luck and tactics, see if you can gather magical space gems. The first to collect five stones in the same colour wins.
—description from the back of the box (translated)

Ta en rymdpromenad bland stjärnorna och träffa de snälla rymdisarna!  Det gäller att, genom tur och taktik, samla magiska rymdstenar. Den som först har fem rymdstenar i samma färg har vunnit.
—description from the back of the box

Name: Bamse: Gympaspel
Description:
In Bamses fitness game, you can collect cards by doing different moves together with Bamse and his friends. Playing games and moving around at the same time is good for both your muscles and your mind!
—description from the rulebook (translated)

Players try to collect one card in each of 5 different colours. Roll the coloured die, and if a card in the matching colour is available, do the movement shown to win the card.

Movements are things like:

     walk on your toes
     walk backwards
     lie on your stomach and fly like an aeroplane
     run around your friends
     hop like a bunny
     wriggle forwards like an eel
     stand on one leg and pinch your nose
     do a jumping jack


—user summary

I Bamses gympaspel ska du samla på kort genom att göra olika roliga gymparörelser med Bamse och hans vänner. Att spela spel och röra på sig samtidigt är bra både för kroppen och knoppen!
—description from the rulebook

Name: Guardians: Retribution
Description:
New heroes emerge to fight for the future in Guardians: Retribution, the second "Hero Pack" expansion for the Guardians base game. Expand your collection with four new and unique heroes, each with their own distinct set of cards and abilities:


    Therion is a super-powered mercenary with primal strength.
    Ryker is a cunning tactician and legendary soldier.
    Warhead makes use of a nuclear-powered thruster pack to traverse the battlefield and and hit enemies with radioactive attacks.
    Jupiter is a powerful psychic that relies on telekinesis to manipulate gravity around her enemies.


Each hero includes a full power deck and Ultimate card, which can be added to your collection and drafted into new Guardians decks!

—description from the publisher

Name: Aim for the Bullseye
Description:
Statistical simulation game that allows the replay of professional darts tournaments from the 1970s through the 2000s.

Each historical player is presented with an Average Performance rating which is added to a roll of five 10-sided dice to determine who has the upper hand in the head to head match-up.  Historical players also have a Tournament rating which can increase the number of dice rolled.

The higher total over three sets of rolls wins the leg, with each match being a best of 11 competition.

—user summary

Name: Assembly: Re-Sequence & Override
Description:
Re-Sequence & Override brings 2 fresh new challenges which will test even the most experienced of Assembly players. The computer is now trying to take over the assembly line. Will you still escape?  A new double expansion for Assembly, mixing up the rules and introducing Robomeeples.  Base game is required.

—description from the publisher

Name: Alphanasta
Description:
A straight-forward adaptation of the card game Canasta into a word game.  Instead of clustering traditional cards into melds of identical rank, lettered cards are melded into words.

The Alphanasta deck consists of two packs of 54 cards, which combined include: 40 vowels, 48 consonants, 8 doubles (e.g. J/K or  W/X, where you can use it as either letter), 8 pairs (e.g. ER or ED, where both letters are used in the printed order, and 4 triples (ING). Vowels are worth 5 points each, consonants 10, doubles and pairs 20, and triples 50.

Each player is dealt 13 cards each, or 11 in partnership games. In a turn a player: 
1. Draws: either A) the top of the draw pile, or B) the entire discard pile. B) can only be done if the top discard is used to extend an existing word, or meld a new word of 4+ letters using cards from the hand. 
2. May do this as much as they wish: A) meld new words from the hand of 4+ letters; B) add cards to either end of an tabled word of theirs, making it a new word. 
3. Discards a card from the hand, unless they are going out.

Doubles, pairs, and triples are considered Wild cards for the purposes of impure words (it's impure if it ends in a Wild); and of freezing the discard pile (which cannot be drawn unless the top card is used for a new word of 5+ letters rather than 4+).

A player or team may go out if they have at least two Word Canastas (words of 7+ letters), or one Alphanasta (a word of 10+ letters played from the hand).  At this point all players score the sum of the letter values in the words they have on the table, plus these bonuses: 
100 points for going out
300 an impure Word Canasta 
500 a pure Words Canasta
1000 an Alphanasta
100 for each letter over 7 in a Word Canasta.

The first player to reach 3000 points over several hands, or 5000 for partnership games, wins.

—user summary

Name: Carcassonne Maps: Deutschland
Description:
With Carcassonne Maps we offer you a new possibility to play Carcassonne. With Carcassonne Maps: Deutschland you can use your tiles and meeples in Germany, build German cities and influence the course of important roads. There are also new ways to score points, e.g. by winning the scoring of a big city or by connecting streets to neighboring countries.

The map consists of high-quality, strong, linen-embossed paper and has the size A1.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Dragons of Thruduit
Description:
Dragons of Thruduit is an LCG game where you battle with elemental dragons!

Object of the game: in order to win you need to defeat all the opponents dragons. This can be done in any assortment of ways, but will be discussed later.

Dragons of Thruduit’s play has phases to it. 
1: draw phase
2: level phase
3: play phase
4: attack phase 
5: resolve phase
6: end phase

-Draw phase-
During the draw phase each player draws a single card. The player who goes first does not get to draw a card on their first turn.

-Level phase-
For this phase each player gains soul tokens equal to their head dragon's soul cost. You can only have a max soul count of 20. If you go above this, just take 20.
Now each player can choose to level up. If you have 10 souls then you can spend them in order to gain one level. Each player starts at level one.

-Play phase-
You may now play cards. If you wish to play a card there are a few requirements you must meet. You must be that card’s level or higher, and you must also pay that’s card soul cost. If you do both of these things then you can play the card. After you play a card, remove soul tokens from your soul pool according to the cards soul cost. Example: if you play a card that costs 5 souls, you must remove 5 soul tokens. You can only play 3 cards onto the field a single play phase.

-Attack Phase-
The first player will now attack. The player can choose any number of dragons to attack. Your dragon can only attack at an opponent’s dragon with a lower than or equal level to that dragon. Once you attack that dragon its health decreases by the attacking dragons damage value. You may attack with any number of dragons on the board as long as they can fulfill the requirements above.

-Resolve phase-
Both players now remove health counters from all their dragons that took damage this turn.

-End Phase-
Your turn ends and your opponent's turn starts.

—description from the publisher

Name: Top Word
Description:
The deck has 100 cards, each with a letter and its point value. (The letters have either a goldenrod or a turquoise background, but this has no game value.)

Each player is dealt 7 cards, and 7 more area dealt to the initial discard pile. In turn each player may discard any number of their cards and then draw that many from the deck or discard pile (but not both). This is done a second time, and then players have 60 second to form their hand into words.  Players then get the point value of all the cards in the longest word they make, with a bonus of 10 points going to the best hand (typically the hand with the longest word).  Hands are done until an agreed time is expired or an agreed winning point total is reached.

—user summary

Name: Wild Guess Chase!
Description:
The game has 72 letter cards and a 1-minute sand timer. With 4 or more players, teams of 2-3 players are recommended.

Each player (or team) is dealt 8 cards, and each player makes a word of 3 or more letters from their hand. (They may discard and draw 3 cards until they are able to make a word.)

In their turn, a player is the Word Hider, who lays out their word face down, turns the first letter face up, and starts the timer.  Each other player shouts out guesses for the word. At any time before the timer runs out, if 2 or more players agree to see another letter, the Word Hider reveals another letter, and the guessing continues.  Once a player correctly guesses the word, the Word Hider says "That's it" and reveals the word; the player who guessed it keeps all the cards that were hidden when the correct guess was made. If no correct guess is made, the Word Hider keeps all the letters of the word.  Unclaimed cards are discarded, and Word Hider fills their hand back to 8 cards.

Players keep taking turns being the Word Hider until the deck runs out and no one can make a word from their hand. At that point, the player with the most cards won from guesses is the winner.

—user summary

Name: Stuck for Words
Description:
Includes 200 letter cards and a sand timer.

Each player draws 16 letters face down. The timer is turned, and each player turns their letters face up, arranges them into a 4x4 grid, and moves them around to form the longest word they can find. When time runs out, if the word is valid, they keep the letters used, and the rest are returned.

After 4 rounds, the player with the most kept letters wins. Play can be varied in difficulty with more or fewer letters, or in length with more or fewer rounds.

—user summary

Name: Pirate Attack!:  The Magic Shop
Description:
The first expansion pack of 50 cards Pirate Attack- The Magic Shop, adds a Magic Shop full of things to help your ships and hurt your enemies.

Double your ships cannons, double its strength, reincarnate a ship, make a ship fire to the left or right instead of its normal target.

Also adds a Hurricane Card and The Royal Navy.

This tuck box will fold up and be placed under the plastic tray in the Main Game box and the cards will fit into the Main Game tray.

—description from the publisher

Name: Pirate Attack!: Raise the Dead
Description:
The second expansion pack of 50 cards Pirate Attack- Raise The Dead, adds more ships, more main deck cards and more Magic Cards.

Raise a dead ship, Duplicate a ship, Spirit of Good Fortune, Sails of Invisibility, Eliminate Add Ons are several more of the things in the magic shop to help you and hurt your enemy.

Also adds a 3 larger ships and a larger Royal Navy.

This tuck box will fold up and be placed under the plastic tray in the Main Game box and the cards will fit into the Main Game tray.

—description from the publisher

Name: Pirate Attack!: Miss-Direction
Description:
The third expansion pack of 50 cards Pirate Attack- Miss-Direction, adds more ships, more Magic Cards, more Sea Creatures and Wind Storms.

Exploding Cannons, Miss- Direction to redirect a cards location Force an Attack to force your opponets to attack each other.

Also adds 2 more ships, Stranded on an Island, Whirlpools and Wind Storms.

This tuck box will fold up and be placed under the plastic tray in the Main Game box and the cards will fit into the Main Game tray.

—description from the publisher

Name: Pirate Attack!:  Walk the Plank
Description:
The forth expansion pack of 100 cards and 2 Dice Pirate Attack- Walk The Plank, adds another ship, more Magic Cards and many new play cards that create all new things to happen during the game.

Force Field, Vision to remove Sails of Invisibility, Return to Port to send ships back to port and get rid of the Armada Card and The Gambler to gamble gold or ships against other players.

Also adds another ship, Walk The Plank, The Trap, Smoke Screen, Power Play, The Magician, Damn Pirates, Insurance, Davy Jones Locker, End Of The World and other bonus cards.

This tuck box will fold up and be placed under the plastic tray in the Main Game box and the cards will fit into the Main Game tray.

—description from the publisher

Name: Pirate Attack!:  The Tavern
Description:
The fifth expansion pack of 100 cards and 1 Chip Pirate Attack- The Tavern, adds a whole new market. The Tavern is a place where you can bribe a drunk sailor into telling you secrets and information, some good, some bad.

The Tavern is full of good and bad items.  Items that will help you, give you bonuses or hurt you or other players.  You take your chance at The Tavern, but when it helps, it really helps.

Also adds some bonus cards to the main deck.

This tuck box will fold up and be placed under the plastic tray in the Main Game box and the cards will fit into the Main Game tray.

—description form the publisher

Name: Pirate Attack!:  Special Abilities
Description:
The sixth (and final) expansion pack of 50 cards and 2 Dice Pirate Attack- Special Abilities, gives players (who choose to) a Special Ability, but only if they are willing to Sell Their Soul to get it.

These cards are optional for players that want them.  You can get a Special Ability like Magic Master,  Money Master, The Vault, Raid The Shop and more that will help you throughout the game, but to get this you must first Sell Your Soul by getting something like Sharks, Banned From The Bar, Easy Target and No Free Gold.

Also add 20 more ships with special abilities built into the ship.

—description from the publisher

Name: Brook City: The Funkhousers Promo Card
Description:
An Ally / Rival card released as part of the Promo Paradise Kickstarter campaign (2019).

The Funkhousers are part of Brook City’s elite, and when they aren’t attending balls or bidding on priceless art, they’re using their wealth and power to influence elections and shape the world around them to their liking. There isn’t a pie that doesn’t have their fingers in it, and nothing happens in our streets without them knowing about it. They’re permanent fixtures at the Capital Hotel casino (heck, some even say they might own it), where they engage in high stakes games of chance while plotting how best to expand their empire. In fact, gambling seems to be their preferred way of interacting with people; if you meet them, expect them to roll the dice in more ways than one!

Name: Silver City-Opoly
Description:
HOW DO YOU MAKE A GAME ABOUT THE GREAT CITY OF SILVER CITY, NEW MEXICO? While it’s impossible to include everything, we jammed all the Silver City we could into this box. It’s full of outdoor adventures, family attractions, family attractions, and of course... world-renowned ancient cliff dwellings - a little something for every Silver City citizen! Looking for a fun way to experience the town that snard Bill the Kid?

HERE’S A QUICK IDEA OF HOW TO PLAY! Buy your favorite SIlver City properties, increase your rent by collecting City Blocks and trading them in for Keys to the City. Sound easy? Well, add in some traffic jams, property tax and parking fines and it gets a little more difficult and a lot more fun! GET YOUR GAME ON!

So choose your token and advance to GO SILVER CITY! You may soon be the Mayor… or out of the game for eating too many New Mexico Enchiladas from the Jalisco Cafe! THIS IS SILVER CITY... AND IT’S YOUR ROLL!

—description from the publisher

Name: Wordage
Description:
Wordage has two identical decks; one deck is used for 2-4 players, both decks for 5-8 players. Each deck has: 3 A's and E's, 2 O's, I's and S's, and 1 of each other letter, all in red, and the same again all in black, plus two Joiner cards that can stand for any letter, making 68 cards. Each letter has a point value of 1-5.

Each player is dealt 14 cards (children 10 cards), and during their turn a player draws a card, lays down cards if possible, and discards a card. The initial lay-down must be one or more words that have at least 14 points in value and include at least one 5+ letter word in one color (for children, at least 10 points and no color requirement). A word's value is the sum of its letters' values, plus bonuses for length, doubled if the word is of one color.

In turns after the initial lay-down, a player may also: draw the top discard instead of the top of the deck; add letters to any word on the table instead of playing a new word (this doesn't score points, though); replace a Joiner (wild) card with the letter it currently stands from from the hand.

The player who plays all the cards in their hand except one which is then discarded, wins the round. The game is won by the first player to win two rounds consecutively; for shorter games, the consecutive requirement is dropped.

In the party version of the game, points for words played are tallied and totaled -- a score pad is included -- and a round's winner gets a bonus of 50 points plus the values of the cards left in others' hands.

—user summary

Name: Countdown
Description:
This is the word-game portion of the popular British game show. (It does not include the numbers game or the conundrum game.) It includes 22 vowel cards, 33 consonant cards, a tray, and sand timer.

During a player's turn they turn up 9 cards from the vowel and consonant decks, with the balance of vowels and consonants up to them. They then turn the timer and everyone writes down words they can form from the revealed cards, trying to come up with the longest word.  When time is up, the player with the longest word scores the length of their word; tied players all score. The winner is the player with the highest score after an agreed number of rounds.

There are also rules for a Word Count Game. The mechanics are the same, but players score for every word they write down: 
1 pt - 3 letters
2 pts - 4 letters
3 pts - 5 letters
5 pts - 6-8 letters
10 pts - 9 letters
The highest score after the agreed number of rounds wins.

—user summary

Name: Age of Steam Expansion: Kansas Tornadoes
Description:
This expansion brings the destructiveness of tornadoes to Age of Steam. Set in the state of Kansas, a season of tornado outbreaks across the state must be dealt with. While the effects of the tornadoes can be chaotic, proper planning and use of the Emergency Response/Forecast special action are crucial.

—description from the designer

Name: Go to Hell! The Game
Description:
Whoever thought that telling someone to “Go to Hell!” would be a compliment? Gather your friends and family together for a devilish dash through the fiery pits of Dante’s Inferno! Compete with your loved ones to be the first to make your way through all seven deadly sins and go to Hell. It includes one gameboard, one die, four game pieces and 20 Hell Cards! Just don't get sent to Heaven unless you have the Get Out of Heaven Free card. It's a race to the bottom that's so much fun, it's sinful!

—description from the publisher

Name: Das grosse Bibel-Quiz-Spiel
Description:
777 questions and answers about the bible. Goal of the game is to get a complete set of cards consisting of 5 different categories and create a Picture with all of them.

—user summary
